items.title: Jamie Dimon sells about $31.5 million worth of JPMorgan shares
items.description: Dimon had also offloaded some shares last year in his first such sale since taking over the top role in 2005.  JPMorgan, the largest U.S. lender, last week surpassed its first-quarter profit estimates on record equities trading and higher fees from debt underwriting and advising on mergers.  Dimon's 2024 pay package went up 8.3% to $39 million.

items.title: Factbox-JP Morgan cuts oil price forecasts on weak demand, higher output
items.description: JP Morgan has revised its oil price forecasts downward for 2025 and 2026, citing increased production from the OPEC+ alliance and a projected decline in global demand, as per a note on Monday. The bank cut its 2025 Brent price forecast to $66 per barrel from $73 per barrel and 2026 target to $58 from $61.
